champ.champInfo:
General management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out National Ukrainian Federation of IKO Nakamura.
The direct organization and conduct of the competition is entrusted to the management of the public organization Kyiv Kyokushin Karate Club "Tenno Dojo", the organizing committee and the panel of judges appointed for this competition


Chief judge of the competition: President of NUF IKO NAKAMURA, judge of the international category Shikhan Ivan Zvizdun, 5-Dan (city of Dnipro).
Head of the judging corps: Vice President of the NUF IKO NAKAMURA, judge of the international category Sensei Serhiy Trofimets, 3- Dan (Kyiv).
Chief Secretary of the competition: NUF IKO NAKAMURA, judge of the national category Sempai Roman Surkov 2nd Dan (Poltava).
Honorary guest of the 1st Open Championship of the city of Kyiv IKO NAKAMURA: Kyokushin Karate World Champion Shihan Piotor Sawicki, 6-Dan (Poland)

Athletes from kyokushin karate sports clubs of Kyiv and regions are allowed to participate in competitions. Athletes in the age groups: 6-17 years, inclusive, with training levels 0-9 kyu (white and orange) and 8 kyu+ (blue belts and above) participate in the competition and compete in separate groups according to the Olympic system. The representative of the team reserves the right to weigh the opponent before the start of the match. In case of exceeding the permissible weight error in the category (300g), without taking into account the full equipment (2kg), the competing athlete is automatically subject to disqualification.

Competitions are held - November 5, 2023, MAUP SPORTS COMPLEX, Kyiv, str. Volodymyra Brozhko (Kirovohradska), 17

Competition participants

  • The organizing committee of the competition reserves the right to combine categories in case of an insufficient number of participants - less than 4 participants in a category
  • Combine bordering weight categories
  • Conduct competitions in specified weight categories in a round-robin fashion
  • Categories in which less than 8 participants compete for 3rd place
  • Categories in which 8 or more athletes do not compete for 3rd place are awarded with two thirds
  • If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name within 1 minute, the athlete will be considered defeated

Competition program:

  • 07:30 – 08:30: registration and weighing of athletes
  • 08:30 – 09:00: meeting of judges, formation of judging teams
  • 09:00 – 13:00: competition among children aged 6-11
  • 13:00 - 14:00: lunch break, registration and weighing of athletes aged 12-17
  • 14:00 - 14:30: competition opening ceremony
  • 14:30 – 15:00: awarding of champions and prize-winners among children 6-11 years old
  • 15:00 - 18:00: competition among boys and girls aged 12-17
  • 18:00 – 19:00: closing of the competition, awarding of winners and prize-winners among boys and girls aged 12-17

Men's categories (KUMITE):

  • _U7: -20.0 -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • _U9: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
  • U11: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 45.0+
  • U13: -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
  • U15: -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 55.0+
  • U17: -55.0 -60.0 60.0+

Women's categories (KUMITE):

  • _U7: -20.0 -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • _U9: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
  • U11: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 45.0+
  • U13: -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
  • U15: -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 55.0+
  • U17: -55.0 -60.0 60.0+

Match time

  • _U7: qualifying matches - 1.0 min.+ 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • _U9: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U11: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U13: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3.0 kg)
  • U15: qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3.0 kg)
  • U17: qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 2.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3.0 kg)

Rewarding

  • Participants who won prizes are awarded diplomas, medals and cups of the respective degrees.
  • The rest of the participants are awarded diplomas and a medal of the participant of the competition

Charity contribution for participation in the competition - 700 UAH.

Contacts
